title.value: Analysis of gene expression and use of connectivity mapping to identify drugs for treatment of human glomerulopathies
title.justification: The title directly describes the key content and purpose of the research.
title.quote: Analysis of gene expression and use of connectivity mapping to identify drugs for treatment of human glomerulopathies

extractions.description: The paper investigates gene expression pathways in human glomerulopathies (including membranous nephropathy, focal segmental glomerulosclerosis, and IgA nephropathy) using publicly available datasets. It aims to identify common pathways and potential therapeutic drugs by using connectivity mapping, with a focus on ER stress/unfolded protein response (UPR) and autophagy.

type.justification: The paper involves data collection and analysis from publicly available datasets as well as experimental validation.
type.quote: The paper investigates gene expression pathways in human glomerulopathies (including membranous nephropathy, focal segmental glomerulosclerosis, and IgA nephropathy) using publicly available datasets.

name.justification: The study is focused on gene expression and potential drug treatments for kidney diseases, specifically glomerulopathies.
name.quote: Human glomerular diseases, including primary glomerulonephritis (GN)—membranous nephropathy (MN), focal segmental glomerulosclerosis (FSGS) and IgA nephropathy (IgAN), as well as diabetic nephropathy (DN) are leading causes of chronic kidney disease.

name.justification: The use of connectivity mapping and gene expression analysis tools is central to this study.
name.quote: To compile a set of genes associated with ER function and ER stress/UPR, we combined genes listed in the Protein Processing in the ER KEGG pathway.

name.justification: The study analyzes molecular pathways such as the unfolded protein response and autophagy at the gene level.
name.quote: In the ER, secreted and membrane proteins are covalently modified (e.g., glycosylated) and attain a correctly folded conformation by the action of folding enzymes and chaperones, prior to transport to the secretory pathway.

name.justification: Nephroseq is extensively used in the study for gene expression analysis in glomerulopathies.
name.quote: The publicly accessible Nephroseq dataset 'JuCKD-Glom' (GSE47183) was used for the expression analysis of glomerular genes, including genes associated with the ER/UPR and autophagy.
